mod_advert.text: Looks like you have Mods Installed
Would you like to configure them before starting the game?

charting_adv_1.text: Chart Editor Wiki:
A small wiki to make it easier to use the Editor.
[Tab 1] Song:

Play Song:
You will be able to play the song you are editing.

SONG:
You can enter the name of the song.

CATEGORY:
You can put the Category of the Song.

DIFFICULTY:
You can set the Difficulty of the Song.

Save Song:
You can automatically save the Song
[Including Global Events].

Save Song As:
You will be able to save the song in your chosen path
[Including Global Events].

Import Chart:
You can import a chart based on a file of your choice.

Import Events:
You can import a Global Event based on a file of your choice.

Load Song:
You can load the song based on the fields `SONG`,
`CATEGORY` and `DIFFICULTY`.

Player:
Here appears the Strum that the Main Player will play in Story Mode.

Stage:
The Name of the Stage used in the Song.

Style:
The Name of the Style used in the Song. This will affect the HUD except for the Notes.

Scroll Speed:
The Speed at which the Notes will go in the Song.

BPM:
It's Beats Per Second in the Song.

Song has Voices?:
A Check that verifies whether the song has Vocals or not.
Characters:

In this section you control everything regarding the
Characters of the Song.

Focus Current Character:
The Camera will focus on the selected Character while the Song is Paused.

Character:
The Chosen Character.

Create Character:
Create a Character and Add it to the Stage.

Delete Character:
Removes the Chosen Character from the Stage.

Character Name:
The Name of the Character.

Aspect:
The Character Aspect.

onRight?:

Conditions if the Character is facing Right.

X:
The X-Position of the Character.

Y:
The Y-Position of the Character.

Size:
The Character Scale.

Layout:
The Layer in which the Character is located in relation to the Stage.

Enable Autosave:
Conditions whether the Chart will be saved after a period of time..

Load Autosave:
Load the Last Chart Saved by AutoSave.

Clear Song Notes:
Remove all Notes from the Chart.

Clear Song Strum Notes:
Remove all Notes from a Specific Row of the Chart.

Clear Song Events:
Remove all Events from the Chart.
[Tab 2] Section:

Current Strum:
Options with respect to the Selected Row.

Send to Back:
Move the row backwards.

Send to BackFront:
Move the row forward.

Strum Keys:
The Number of Keys in the Row.

Note Style:
The chosen Style of the Row.

Characters To Sing:
The Group of Characters Singing in the Row.

General Section:
General Section Options.

BPM:
You can change the BPM of the Section using the `Change BPM`
(If the BPM is deactivated, it will be the last change made).

Section Length:
Section Size.

Strum To Focus:
The row on which the camera will focus.
To the right of the button you can see which character the camera will focus on with respect to the row.

Clear Events:
Delete Section Events.

Current Strum Section:
Row Options in that Section.

Change Alt:
You will have the Characters in that Row use their Alternate Animations.

Strum Keys:
You can change the Row Note Number in that Respective Section by using the
`Change Keys`
(If Note Number is deactivated, it will be the last change made).

Clear All Section:
You will be able to delete all the notes in the section.

Clear Strum Section:
You will be able to delete all the Notes in the Row in that Section.

Copy Section:
You can copy all Section Notes.

Paste Section:
You can Paste all Section Notes.

Set Last Section:
You will place the number of the copied section with respect to the current section in the cells of
the 'Paste Last'.

Paste Last Section:
The Section Notes will be pasted to the number marked in the right
Cell
with respect to the Current Section.

Paste Last Strum:
It will paste the Notes of the Section that is at the number marked in the First Right Cell with respect to the Current Section in the Row marked according to the Second Right Cell.

Swap Strum:
The Notes of the current Row and the Row Marked by the Right Cell will be changed from Row to Row.

Mirror Strum:
Current Row Notes will be Inverted.

Mirror Strum:
Current Section Notes Will Be Reversed.

Synchronize Notes:
All row notes will be synchronised.

Change Characters to Sing:
Characters marked in the Bottom Cell in that Section will be used if this Condition is Active.
[Tab 3] Note:

Note:
Options with respect to the Selected Note.

StrumTime:
The Position of the Note in relation to the Current Section.

Note Length:
The size of the note, this will mark whether the note will be sustained or not.

Note Hits:
Hits to be made to this Note. This will mark whether the Note is MultiTap.

Note Presset:
Pressets are files that have different functions that will be applied to the note. If the note has a Presset, it will only have the events of its Presset.

Event List:
The List of Available Events for the Note. The Button on the Right is for Adding an Event to the Note.

Current Event:
The List of Events that the Note Holds. The Right Button is for Deleting the Current Event.

Condition:
This marks the Condition that must be Fulfilled to Execute this Event.
There are 3 different events:
OnHit: When the Note is Pressed.
OnMiss: When the Note is Failed.
OnCreate: When the Note is Created.

Celdas Especiales:
Each Event creates Special Cells according to each Argument it needs.

Event:
The Options regarding the Selected Event.

StrumTime:
The Position of the Event in relation to the Current Section.

Event List:
The List of Available Events for the Event.
The Right Button is for Adding an Event to the Event.

Current Event:
The List of Events that the Event Owns.
The Right Button is for Deleting the Current Event..

Local Event o Global Event:
This button indicates whether the event is Local or Global. Local Events will appear only in this Chart. Global Events will be saved in a separate file and will be played regardless of the difficulty of the song.

Event Active o Event Broke:
This button only works if the event is Global.
Event Active indicates that the event will be executed normally.
Event Broke: indicates that the event will not be executed in this specific chart.

Celdas Especiales:
Each Event creates Special Cells according to each Argument it needs.
[Tab 4] Settings:

Mute Instrumental:
Remove the Volume of the Instrumental.

Mute Voices:
Remove Volume from Voices.

Enable Voices:
Activate the Volume of All Voices.

Toggle Voices:
Switches the Volume of the Voices (If they are On, they are Off and vice versa).

Disable Voices:
Remove Volume from all Voices.

Mute HitSounds:
Remove Volume from Hits when a Note is Pressed.

Enable Hits:
Activates the Volume of all Hits.

Toggle Hits:
Swaps the Volume of the Hits (If they are On they are Off and Vice versa).

Disable Hits:
Disables the Volume of all Hits.

Hide Chart:
Hides all Chart Rows leaving only the Stage.

Hide Strums:
Hide Static Notes in Each Row.

Cam Focus Strum when Playing:
Editor Focuses on the Row on Which the Camera Focuses when the Song is Playing.

Disable [Add / Del] Strum Buttons:
Disable Add and Delete Row Buttons.

Height Size:
This is the Number of Snaps in which the Note can be placed in the Editor.
Add and Del Buttons:

Add Button:
Add a New Row to the Song.

Del Button:
Remove Current Row.
Buttons Per Row:

Microfono:
Dictate whether the Voices of this Row Will Sound.

Mando:
Dictate if this Row will be Playable in Duel Mode.

Tambor:
Dictate whether Notes in this Row will have HitSounds.
Shortcuts:

Scroll:
Move the Section one Step.

Scroll + Shift:
You will move the Half Step Section.

Scroll + Control:
You will change the size of the notes.

Left Click on Selected Row:
You will place a Note in the Row.

Right Click on a Row:
Select that Row.

E:
You will increase the length of the selected note.

Q:
You will decrease the length of the selected note..

E + Shift:
You will increase the MultiTap of the Selected Note.

Q + Shift:
You will decrease the MultiTap of the selected note.

Up Arrow:
You will go to the section above.

Down Arrow:
You will go to the section below.

Left Arrow:
You will be moved to the previous section.

Right Arrow:
You will be moved to the next section.

Left Arrow + Shift:
You will move to the previous row.

Right Arrow + Shift:
You will move to the next row.

R:
You will return to the top of the section.

R + Shift:
You will return to the beginning of the song.

R + Controls:
Return Notes to Original Size.
